intro: Ruttya, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and milky sap. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its branching structure and small, inconspicuous flowers. Ruttya is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage. Its sap contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation if handled without protection.
